amendment.description: Amendment requires the Secretary of Homeland Security to report to Congress on the agency's efforts to reduce the replication of its badges, uniforms and other insignia; and report on the agency's efforts to increase public awareness of counterfeit badges and uniforms.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 15 printed in Part B of House Report 109-84 to require the Secretary of DHS to report to Congress within 6 months of the enactment of the bill on its efforts to (1) reduce the imitation of badges, identification, uniforms, or other insignia used by any officer of DHS; (2) improve the design of the various forms of DHS identification to prevent illegal replication; (3) increase public awareness of imitation forms of Homeland Security identification; (4) teach the public to identify authentic Homeland Security identification; (5) assess the effectiveness of their efforts; and (6) recommend any legislation or administrative actions necessary to achieve their objectives.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Slaughter amendment (A015) Agreed to by voice vote.
